alert.note: Alert for Cibola; McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following counties, Cibola and McKinley. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly north across Zuni Indian Reservation. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Zuni Pueblo, Black Rock, Ramah and Pescado. - State Roads 36, 52, and 602, Reservation Roads 4, 5, 7, 8, and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
